Short name (diplayed in dropbox): All restaurants in {district} with aprox rate of {stars}
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX geo: <http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#>
PREFIX geof: <http://www.opengis.net/def/function/geosparql/>
PREFIX gnis: <http://smartopendata.gsi.dit.upm.es/rdf/gnis/>
PREFIX gu: <http://smartopendata.gsi.dit.upm.es/rdf/gu/> 
PREFIX drf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
PREFIX dbpedia-owl: <http://dbpedia.org/property/>
prefix text: <http://jena.apache.org/text#>
PREFIX gp: <http://sefarad.gsi.dit.upm.es/rdf/gp/> 


SELECT * WHERE {

SERVICE <http://localhost:3030/books/query> {
        ?s geo:hasGeometry ?fGeom .
        ?fGeom geo:asWKT ?fWKT .
        ?s gu:GEOCODIGO ?geocodigo  .
        ?s gu:DESBDT ?desbdt .  
        ?s owl:sameAs ?dbpediaLink .  

    }

SERVICE <http://localhost:3030/geo/query> {

?d ?p ?o 

  FILTER(REGEX(?o, ?desbdt))
  FILTER(str(?desbdt)="<district>") 


    }

SERVICE <http://localhost:3030/geo/query> {

  ?d gp:price ?price .
  ?d gp:foodtype ?foodtype .
  ?d gp:stars ?stars .
  FILTER(str(?stars)="<stars>") 


    }


}
Explanation (long explanation to be show: Return all restaurants in the selected district with at least the selected rate.
parameter1:
Salamanca,
Arganzuela,
Retiro,
Tetuán,
Chamberí,
Usera

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Multilingual example
Cross dataset example
Show top 10 sentiments for {domain} in {language}
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT ( count(distinct ?cx) as ?occurences ) ?sentiment ?sentimentURI 
FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon>
WHERE{
    ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?sentimentURI lemon:canonicalForm ?cf.
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment.
    ?sense lemon:context ?cx.
    ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
}  
GROUP BY ?sentimentURI ?sentiment
ORDER BY DESC(?occurences)
LIMIT 10
Explanation (long explanation to be show:
Configurable template for retrieveing the top 10 sentiment words from a lexicon in the given domain and language.
Configuration: domain language resource
paramDefinition:
electronics ca 0001,
electronics en 0002,
electronics es 0003,
electronics fr 0004,
electronics it 0005,
electronics pt 0006,
hotel ca 0007,
hotel en 0008,
hotel es 0009,
hotel fr 0010,
hotel it 0011,
hotel pt 0012

Which resources it links?: N/A This query shows data within a processed LR.

PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>

FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/electronics/ca/paradigma/0001/lexicon>
WHERE {
    ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?sentimentURI lemon:canonicalForm ?cf.
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment.
    ?sense lemon:context ?cx.
    ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
}  
GROUP BY ?sentimentURI ?sentiment
ORDER BY DESC(?occurences)
LIMIT 10

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show top 10 positive sentiments for {domain} in {language}
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT ( count(distinct ?cx) as ?occurences ) ?sentiment ?sentimentURI 
FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon> 
WHERE {
    ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?sentimentURI lemon:canonicalForm ?cf.
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment.
    ?sense lemon:context ?cx.
    ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
    ?sense marl:hasPolarity <http://purl.org/marl/ns/positive> .
}
GROUP BY ?sentimentURI ?sentiment
ORDER BY DESC(?occurences) limit 10
Explanation (long explanation to be show:
Configurable template for retrieveing top 10 positive sentiment words based on their occurences in the context of existing domain aspects from a lexicon in the given domain and language.
Configuration: domain language resource

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show 50 sentiments for various aspects for {domain} in {language}
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT DISTINCT ?domainAspect ?sentiment ?polarityValue 
FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon> 
WHERE {
    ?sentimentEntry lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?sentimentEntry lemon:canonicalForm ?senseCf .
    ?senseCf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment .
    ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
    ?sense marl:hasPolarity ?polarity .
    ?sense lemon:reference ?reference .
    ?sense lemon:context ?context .
    ?entryWithSentiment lemon:sense ?context .
    ?entryWithSentiment lemon:canonicalForm ?cf .
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?domainAspect .
}  
LIMIT 50
Explanation (long explanation to be show:
Configurable template for retrieveing 50 sentiment words and their related domain aspects from a 
lexicon in the given domain and language.
Configuration: domain language resource

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show the domain aspects that are described as {sentimentValue} in {domain} for {language} .
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT DISTINCT ?domainAspect ?sentiment ?polarityValue
FROM  <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon>
WHERE {
    <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicalentry/<sentimentValue>> lemon:sense ?sense .
    <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicalentry/<sentimentValue>> lemon:canonicalForm ?senseCf .
    ?senseCf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment .
    ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
    ?sense marl:hasPolarity ?polarity .
    ?sense lemon:reference ?reference .
    ?sense lemon:context ?context .
    ?entryWithSentiment lemon:sense ?context .
    ?entryWithSentiment lemon:canonicalForm ?cf .
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?domainAspect .
} 
ORDER BY DESC(?polarityValue)
Explanation (long explanation to be show:
Configurable template for retrieveing the domain aspects that are annotated with a given sentiment from a 
lexicon in the given domain and language.
Configuration: domain language resource sentimentValue(s)

FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon>
WHERE {
    ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?sentimentURI lemon:canonicalForm ?senseCf .

}
ORDER BY DESC(?polarityValue)

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show the uris for a given entity, domain and language
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
SELECT distinct ?sentimentURI
WHERE{
    GRAPH ?g {
        ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
        ?conceptURI rdf:label ?label
        FILTER (STR(?label)='<entity>')  .
        ?g lemon:language ?lang FILTER (STR(?lang) = '<language>') .
        ?g lemon:topic <domainURI> .
    }
}
LIMIT 20
Explanation (long explanation to be show:
Configurable template for retrieving the URIs for an entity given its language and domain.
IF language and or domain are not provided then you can remove thier associated lines in the query. (i.e.  ?g lemon:language ?lang FILTER (STR(?lang) = '<language>') . for language and ?g lemon:topic <domainURI> . for domain)
We use ISO standards for languages: ca, en, es, fr, it , pt etc...
Here are the used domains and their URIs:
electronics - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Electronics>
hotel - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Tourism>
telco - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Telecommunication>
cars - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Vehicles>
food - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Food>
politics - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Politics>
drinks - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Food>,                
bank - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Banking>
insurance - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Insurance>
art - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Art>
technology - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Engineering>, 
pharmaceuticals - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Pharmacy>
post - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Post>
news - <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/wndomains/news>,                        
music - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Music>
finance - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Finance>
movies - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Cinema>
health - <http://www.gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/wndomains/ns#Health>

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show top 10 domain aspects in {domain} and {language}.
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT count(?sentiSense) as ?occurences ?aspect ?aspectURI
FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon>
WHERE {
    ?aspectURI lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?aspectURI lemon:canonicalForm ?cf.
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?aspect.
    FILTER NOT EXISTS {?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue} 
    ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sentiSense.
    ?sentiSense lemon:context ?sense.
}
GROUP BY ?aspectURI ?aspect 
ORDER BY DESC(?occurences)
LIMIT 10
paramDefinition:
electronics ca 0001,
electronics en 0002,
electronics es 0003,
electronics fr 0004,
electronics it 0005,
electronics pt 0006,
hotel ca 0007,
hotel en 0008,
hotel es 0009,
hotel fr 0010,
hotel it 0011,
hotel pt 0012

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show the translation of a sentiment from a domain and a language based on the connections to BabelNet via WordNet references.
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX lb:    <http://www.lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX wn30:    <http://lemon-model.net/lexica/pwn/>
PREFIX lexinfo:    <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/2.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://gsi.dit.upm.es/ontologies/marl#>

SELECT distinct ?translationLabel WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon> {
    <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicalentry/<sentimentValue>>   a lemon:LexicalEntry.
    <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicalentry/<sentimentValue>>   lemon:sense ?sense.
    ?sense lemon:reference ?wn30.
  } 
  ?wn31 owl:sameAs ?wn30 .
  ?concept skos:exactMatch ?wn31.
  ?concept lb:isReferenceOf ?anothersense.
  ?anothersense lexinfo:translation ?translation.
  ?anotherentry lb:sense ?translation .
  ?anotherentry lb:language "<translatein>".
  ?anotherentry rdfs:label ?translationLabel.
} LIMIT 20
Explanation (long explanation to be show:
Configurable template for retrieving translations in german, spanish or italian for english sentiment lexicons based on the BabelNet connections via the WordNet references.
Configuration:
domain language resource translatein
electronics en 0002 DE
electronics en 0002 ES
electronics en 0002 IT
electronics en 0002 RO
hotel en 0008 DE
hotel en 0008 ES
hotel en 0008 IT
hotel en 0008 RO
paramDefinition:
electronics en 0002 DE,
electronics en 0002 ES,
electronics en 0002 IT,

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): This is q query to get 20 positive sentiments for query 31
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT ( count(distinct ?cx) as ?occurences ) ?sentiment ?sentimentURI 
FROM <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon> 
WHERE {
    ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
    ?sentimentURI lemon:canonicalForm ?cf.
    ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment.
    ?sense lemon:context ?cx.
    ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
    ?sense marl:hasPolarity <http://purl.org/marl/ns/positive> .
}
GROUP BY ?sentimentURI ?sentiment
ORDER BY DESC(?occurences) limit 20

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show translations of a lexical entry based on the connections to BabelNet via WordNet references.
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX lb: <http://www.lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX wn30: <http://lemon-model.net/lexica/pwn/>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/2.0/lexinfo#>


SELECT distinct ?entryLabel ?translationLabel WHERE {
GRAPH <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/<domain>/<language>/paradigma/<resource>/lexicon>  {
 ?entry a lemon:LexicalEntry.
 ?entry rdfs:label ?entryLabel .
 ?entry lemon:sense ?sense.
 ?sense lemon:reference ?wn30.
 }
 ?wn31 owl:sameAs ?wn30 .
 ?concept skos:exactMatch ?wn31.
 ?concept lb:isReferenceOf ?anothersense.
 ?anothersense lexinfo:translation ?translation.
 ?anotherentry lb:sense ?translation .
 ?anotherentry lb:language "<translatein>".
 ?anotherentry rdfs:label ?translationLabel.
} limit 20
Explanation (long explanation to be show: Configurable template for retrieving translations in different languages  for english lexical entries based on the BabelNet connections via the WordNet references.
paramDefinition:
electronics en 0002 DE,
electronics en 0002 ES,
electronics en 0002 IT,
electronics en 0002 RO,
hotel en 0008 DE,
hotel en 0008 ES,
hotel en 0008 IT,
hotel en 0008 RO

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show most popular sentiments in TripAdvisor
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
PREFIX marl: <http://purl.org/marl/ns/>
SELECT count(distinct ?cx) as ?occurences ?sentiment ?sentimentURI from <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/hotel/en/ta/0060/lexicon> where{
 ?sentimentURI lemon:sense ?sense .
 ?sentimentURI lemon:canonicalForm ?cf.
 ?cf lemon:writtenRep ?sentiment.
 ?sense lemon:context ?cx.
 ?sense marl:polarityValue ?polarityValue .
} group by ?sentimentURI ?sentiment order by DESC(?occurences) limit 20
Explanation (long explanation to be show: Lists top 20 sentiments that describe most of the aspect terms in the TripAdvisor corpus.

Short name (diplayed in dropbox): Show translations of composed words from TripAdvisor lexicon.
Actual SPARQL query Please format it wit:
PREFIX lemon: <http://lemon-model.net/lemon#>
SELECT distinct ?ENwrittenRepresentation ?TranslationWrittenRepresentation WHERE {

 <http://www.eurosentiment.eu/dataset/hotel/en/ta/0060/lexicalentry/<domain>>  lemon:sense ?senseEN.
  ?Tentry lemon:sense ?senseT .
  ?senseT <http://www.isocat.org/datcat/translationOf> ?senseEN.
  ?ENlexicon a lemon:Lexicon.
